title: New Holland LX865 Skid Steer: How to Flush Water-Contaminated Hydraulic Oil & Prevent Future Issues.

tasks.task: Drain reservoir and flush hydraulic lines on New Holland machinery due to water contamination.
subtasks: Remove dipstick and siphon contaminated oil from tank.
Use electric pump to extract oil from reservoir.
Inspect reservoir cap filter and gaskets for water ingress points.
Replace damaged gaskets and apply silicone sealant around cap and filler opening.
Place cover over dipstick area with silicone seal to prevent future water entry.
Refill reservoir with clean hydraulic fluid and cycle machine to bleed lines.
Flush auxiliary lines by connecting bleed plugs to collection buckets.
Ensure all lines are free of water and contaminated fluid during bleeding process.
Change hydraulic filter as part of maintenance.

tasks.task: Prevent future water contamination in hydraulic reservoir.
subtasks: Seal cap interior filter properly during assembly.
Apply silicone sealant to critical junctions where water previously entered (e.g., gasket areas).
Modify reservoir cover with a plastic container top fortified with silicone sealant to prevent water entry.

tasks.task: Drain reservoir and flush hydraulic lines to remove water contamination.
Prevent future water contamination in hydraulic reservoir.
Drain hydraulic reservoir and flush lines to remove water contamination.
Implement preventative measures to prevent future water contamination in reservoir.
MAINTASK: Drain reservoir and flush hydraulic lines to remove water contamination.
Implement preventative measures to stop future water contamination.
